revised_title: Anatomy of the Central Nervous System in Plagiostomata
tldr: The author examines the anatomy of the central nervous system in various species of plagiostomata, focusing on the brain structure, cranial nerves, and spinal cord. They describe the macroscopic appearance of the brains, the distribution of cranial nerves, and the structure of the cerebrum, cerebellum, and optic lobes. The study provides insights into the similarities and differences in the nervous system of these species.
